classData.comment:
/**
 * @class Neo.collection.Base
 * @extends Neo.core.Base
 */
classData.name: Base

classData.comment:
/**
     * True automatically applies the core.Observable mixin
     * @member {Boolean} observable=true
     * @static
     */
classData.description: True automatically applies the core.Observable mixin
classData.name: observable

classData.comment:
/**
         * @member {String} className='Neo.collection.Base'
         * @protected
         */
classData.name: className

classData.comment:
/**
         * @member {String} ntype='collection'
         * @protected
         */
classData.name: ntype

classData.comment:
/**
         * When filtering the collection for the first time, allItems will become a new collection for the unfiltered
         * state, using this id as the sourceCollectionId
         * @member {Neo.collection.Base|null} allItems=null
         * @protected
         */
classData.description: When filtering the collection for the first time, allItems will become a new collection for the unfiltered state, using this id as the sourceCollectionId
classData.name: allItems

classData.comment:
/**
         * True to sort the collection items when adding / inserting new ones
         * @member {Boolean} autoSort=true
         */
classData.description: True to sort the collection items when adding / inserting new ones
classData.name: autoSort

classData.comment:
/**
         * Use 'primitive' for default filters, use 'advanced' for filters using a filterBy method
         * which need to iterate over other collection items
         * @member {String} filterMode='primitive'
         */
classData.description: Use 'primitive' for default filters, use 'advanced' for filters using a filterBy method which need to iterate over other collection items
classData.name: filterMode

classData.comment:
/**
         * An Array containing Neo.util.Filter config objects or instances
         * @member {Array} filters_=[]
         */
classData.description: An Array containing Neo.util.Filter config objects or instances
classData.name: filters_
items_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The unique(!) key property of each collection item
         * @member {String} keyProperty='id'
         */
classData.description: The unique(!) key property of each collection item
classData.name: keyProperty

classData.comment:
/**
         * Adding new items without an id (keyProperty) will use a negative index, which will decrease by -1
         * for each new item
         * @member {Number} keyPropertyIndex=-1
         */
classData.description: Adding new items without an id (keyProperty) will use a negative index, which will decrease by -1 for each new item
classData.name: keyPropertyIndex

classData.comment:
/**
         * A map containing the key & reference of each collection item for faster access
         * @member {Map} map_=null
         * @protected
         */
classData.description: A map containing the key & reference of each collection item for faster access
classData.name: map_

classData.comment:
/**
         * An internal Array of the sort directions for faster access
         * @member {Array} sortDirections=null
         * @protected
         */
classData.description: An internal Array of the sort directions for faster access
classData.name: sortDirections

classData.comment:
/**
         * An internal Array of the sort properties for faster access
         * @member {Array} sortProperties=null
         * @protected
         */
classData.description: An internal Array of the sort properties for faster access
classData.name: sortProperties

classData.comment:
/**
         * An Array containing Neo.util.Sorter config objects or instances
         * @member {Array} sorters_=[]
         */
classData.description: An Array containing Neo.util.Sorter config objects or instances
classData.name: sorters_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The id of another collection instance to use as this data source
         * @member {String|null} sourceId_=null
         */
classData.description: The id of another collection instance to use as this data source
classData.name: sourceId_
construct

classData.comment:
/**
     * Adds one or more items to the end of the collection
     * @param {Array|Object} item The item(s) to add
     * @returns {Object[]} an array containing all added items
     */
classData.description: Adds one or more items to the end of the collection

returns.description: an array containing all added items

/**

classData.comment:
/**
     * Saves the sort property & direction multiplier of each sorter inside 2 arrays for faster access when sorting
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Saves the sort property & direction multiplier of each sorter inside 2 arrays for faster access when sorting
classData.name: applySorterConfigs

classData.comment:
/**

classData.comment:

classData.comment:
/**
     * @param opts
     * @protected
     */
classData.name: cacheUpdate

classData.description: Removes all items and clears the map
classData.name: clear

classData.comment:
/**
     * Clears all current filters and optionally restores the original ones in case they existed.
     * @param {boolean} [restoreOriginalFilters=false]
     */
classData.description: Clears all current filters and optionally restores the original ones in case they existed.
classData.name: clearFilters

classData.description: Removes all items and clears the map, without firing a mutate event
classData.name: clearSilent

classData.comment:
/**
     * Clears all current sorters and optionally restores the original ones in case they existed.
     * Without restoreInitialState as true this will not affect the current sorting of this collection.
     * @param {boolean} [restoreOriginalSorters=false]
     */
classData.description: Clears all current sorters and optionally restores the original ones in case they existed. Without restoreInitialState as true this will not affect the current sorting of this collection.
classData.name: clearSorters

returns.description: The cloned collection

classData.name: clone

classData.description: Clears the map & items array before the super call
classData.name: destroy

classData.comment:
/**
     *
     * @param {Object[]} items=this._items
     * @param {Boolean} silent=false
     * @protected
     */
classData.name: doSort

classData.comment:
/**
     * Resumes the collection events.
     * If you started an update using the startSilentUpdateMode flag,
     * you must use the endSilentUpdateMode param for this call.
     * Using the endSilentUpdateMode param will not fire a mutation event.
     * @param {Boolean} [endSilentUpdateMode]
     * @see {@link Neo.collection.Base#startUpdate startUpdate}
     */
classData.description: Resumes the collection events. If you started an update using the startSilentUpdateMode flag, you must use the endSilentUpdateMode param for this call. Using the endSilentUpdateMode param will not fire a mutation event.
classData.name: endUpdate

classData.description: Needed for remote filtering
classData.name: exportFilters

classData.description: Needed for remote sorting
classData.name: exportSorters
filter

classData.comment:
/**
     * Returns items which match the property and value
     * @param {Object|String} property
     * @param {String|Number} [value] Only required in case the first param is a string
     * @param {Boolean} returnFirstMatch=false
     * @returns {Object|Object[]}
     *     returnFirstMatch=false: Returns an empty Array in case no items are found
     *     returnFirstMatch=true:  Returns the first found item or null
     */
classData.description: Returns items which match the property and value

params.description: Only required in case the first param is a string
params.name: value

returns.description:
returnFirstMatch=false: Returns an empty Array in case no items are found
    returnFirstMatch=true:  Returns the first found item or null

classData.name: find

classData.comment:
/**
     * Returns all items in the collection for which the passed function returns true
     * @param {function} fn The function to run for each item inside the start-end range. Return true for a match.
     * @param {Object} fn.item The current collection item
     * @param {Object} scope=this The scope in which the passed function gets executed
     * @param {Number} start=0 The start index
     * @param {Number} end=this.getCount() The end index (up to, last value excluded)
     * @returns {Array} Returns an empty Array in case no items are found
     */
classData.description: Returns all items in the collection for which the passed function returns true

params.description: The function to run for each item inside the start-end range. Return true for a match.
params.name: fn

params.description: The scope in which the passed function gets executed
params.name: scope

params.description: The end index (up to, last value excluded)
params.name: end

returns.description: Returns an empty Array in case no items are found

classData.name: findBy

classData.comment:
/**
     * Returns the first item which matches the property and value
     * @param {Object|String} property
     * @param {String|Number} [value] Only required in case the first param is a string
     * @returns {Object} Returns the first found item or null
     */
classData.description: Returns the first item which matches the property and value

params.description: Only required in case the first param is a string
params.name: value

returns.description: Returns the first found item or null

classData.name: findFirst

classData.description: Returns the first item inside the collection
classData.name: first

classData.description: Returns the object associated to the key, or null if there is none.
classData.name: get

classData.description: Returns the item for a given index
classData.name: getAt

classData.description: Returns the length of the internal items array
classData.name: getCount
getCountMutations

classData.description: Returns the first matching filter for the given property config
classData.name: getFilter

classData.description: Returns the key for a given index
classData.name: getKeyAt

classData.comment:
/**
     * Returns a shallow copy of a portion of the items array
     * @param {Number} [start] Zero-based index at which to begin extraction.
     * @param {Number} [end] Zero-based index before which to end extraction (extracts up to but not including end).
     * @returns {Array}
     * @link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/slice
     */
classData.description: Returns a shallow copy of a portion of the items array

params.description: Zero-based index at which to begin extraction.
params.name: start

params.description: Zero-based index before which to end extraction (extracts up to but not including end).
params.name: end

classData.name: getRange

classData.description: Returns the Source Collection in case the sourceCollectionId config was set
classData.name: getSource

classData.description: Returns a boolean asserting whether a value has been associated to the key in the Collection or not

classData.description: Returns a boolean asserting whether an item exists in the Collection or not

classData.comment:
/**

classData.description: Returns the index for a given key or item

returns.description: index (-1 in case no match is found)

/**

/**

isFilteredItem

/**

     * @param {*} value

returns.description: returns true for object-like values

     */

returns.description: The removed element from the collection; undefined if the collection is empty.

/**

     */
classData.description: Adds one or more items to the end of the collection and returns the new items count

returns.description: the collection count

classData.description: Removes a given key, item or Array containing keys|items

classData.comment:
/**
     * Reverses the items array in place.
     * Intended for collections without sorters.
     * @returns {Array} items
     */
classData.description: Reverses the items array in place. Intended for collections without sorters.

returns.description: items

classData.name: reverse

classData.comment:
/**
     * Removes the first element from the items array and returns this element.
     * @returns {Object} The removed element from the collection; undefined if the collection is empty.
     */
classData.description: Removes the first element from the items array and returns this element.

returns.description: The removed element from the collection; undefined if the collection is empty.

classData.name: shift

classData.comment:
/**
     * @param {function} callback Function to test for each item, taking three parameters:
     * @param {Object}   callback.item The current collection item being processed
     * @param {Number}  [callback.index] The index of the current item being processed
     * @param {Array}   [callback.items] The items array of the collection
     *
     * @param {Object} [scope] Value to use as "this" when executing the callback
     * @returns {boolean} true if the callback function returns a truthy value for any collection item, otherwise false
     */

params.description: Function to test for each item, taking three parameters:
params.name: callback

params.description: The index of the current item being processed
params.name: callback.index

params.description: Value to use as "this" when executing the callback
params.name: scope

returns.description: true if the callback function returns a truthy value for any collection item, otherwise false

classData.name: some

classData.comment:
/**
     * Removes items from and/or adds items to this collection
     * If the toRemoveArray is used, then the index is not used for removing, the entries are found by key and removed from where they are.
     * If index is not passed, toAddArray is appended to the Collection.
     * @param {Number|null} index
     * @param {Number|Object[]} [removeCountOrToRemoveArray]
     * @param {Object|Object[]} [toAddArray]
     * @returns {Object} An object containing the addedItems & removedItems arrays
     */
classData.description: Removes items from and/or adds items to this collection If the toRemoveArray is used, then the index is not used for removing, the entries are found by key and removed from where they are. If index is not passed, toAddArray is appended to the Collection.

returns.description: An object containing the addedItems & removedItems arrays

classData.name: splice

classData.comment:
/**
     * Prevents the collection from firing events until endUpdate gets called.
     * If you start an update using the startSilentUpdateMode param,
     * the mutation event will not fire after using endUpdate()
     * (you must use the endSilentUpdateMode param for the endUpdate call in case you used
     * startSilentUpdateMode here)
     * @param {Boolean} [startSilentUpdateMode]
     * @see {@link Neo.collection.Base#endUpdate endUpdate}
     */
classData.description: Prevents the collection from firing events until endUpdate gets called. If you start an update using the startSilentUpdateMode param, the mutation event will not fire after using endUpdate() (you must use the endSilentUpdateMode param for the endUpdate call in case you used startSilentUpdateMode here)
classData.name: startUpdate

classData.comment:
/**
     * Adds one or more elements to the beginning of the collection and returns the new items count
     * @param {Array|Object} item The item(s) to add
     * @returns {Number} the collection count
     */
classData.description: Adds one or more elements to the beginning of the collection and returns the new items count

returns.description: the collection count

classData.name: unshift

classData.comment:
/**
 * The mutate event fires after every splice call (invoked by all methods which change the content of the items array).
 * @event mutate
 * @param {Object[]} addedItems
 * @param {Boolean} preventBubbleUp private
 * @param {Object[]} removedItems
 * @returns {Object}
 */
classData.description: The mutate event fires after every splice call (invoked by all methods which change the content of the items array).
classData.name: mutate
